questions.question_text: What are canal rays?
hints: canal rays are positively charged radiations

questions.question_text: If an atom contains one electron and one proton, will it carry any charge or not?
hints: opposite charges cancel each other

questions.question_text: On the basis of Thomson’s model of an atom, explain how the atom is neutral as a whole.
hints: positive and negative charges are equal in magnitude

questions.question_text: On the basis of Rutherford’s model of an atom, which subatomic particle is present in the nucleus of an atom?
hints: Rutherford's model proposes a nucleus with positive charge

questions.question_text: Draw a sketch of Bohr’s model of an atom with three shells.
hints: Bohr's model has electrons in discrete orbits

questions.question_text: What do you think would be the observation if the α-particle scattering experiment is carried out using a foil of a metal other than gold?
hints: experiment results depend on the metal used

questions.question_text: Name the three sub-atomic particles of an atom.
hints: electrons, protons, and neutrons

questions.question_text: Helium atom has an atomic mass of 4 u and two protons in its nucleus. How many neutrons does it have?
hints: mass number is the sum of protons and neutrons

questions.question_text: Write the distribution of electrons in carbon and sodium atoms.
hints: electrons are distributed in shells

questions.question_text: If K and L shells of an atom are full, then what would be the total number of electrons in the atom?
hints: K shell has 2 electrons, L shell has 8 electrons

questions.question_text: How will you find the valency of chlorine, sulphur and magnesium?
hints: valency is the combining capacity of an atom

questions.question_text: If number of electrons in an atom is 8 and number of protons is also 8, then (i) what is the atomic number of the atom? and (ii) what is the charge on the atom?
hints: atomic number is the number of protons
opposite charges cancel each other

questions.question_text: With the help of Table 4.1, find out the mass number of oxygen and sulphur atom.
hints: mass number is the sum of protons and neutrons

questions.question_text: For the symbol H, D and T tabulate three sub-atomic particles found in each of them.
hints: sub-atomic particles are electrons, protons, and neutrons

questions.question_text: Write the electronic configuration of any one pair of isotopes and isobars.
hints: electronic configuration is the distribution of electrons in shells

questions.question_text: Compare the properties of electrons, protons and neutrons.
hints: properties include charge, mass, and spin

questions.question_text: What are the limitations of J.J. Thomson’s model of the atom?
hints: Thomson's model does not explain the stability of atoms

questions.question_text: What are the limitations of Rutherford’s model of the atom?
hints: Rutherford's model does not explain the stability of atoms

questions.question_text: Describe Bohr’s model of the atom.
hints: Bohr's model has electrons in discrete orbits

questions.question_text: Compare all the proposed models of an atom given in this chapter.
hints: models include Thomson's, Rutherford's, and Bohr's

questions.question_text: Summarise the rules for writing of distribution of electrons in various shells for the first eighteen elements.
hints: rules include the maximum number of electrons in each shell

questions.question_text: Define valency by taking examples of silicon and oxygen.
hints: valency is the combining capacity of an atom

questions.question_text: Explain with examples (i) Atomic number, (ii) Mass number, (iii) Isotopes and iv) Isobars. Give any two uses of isotopes.
hints: examples include hydrogen, carbon, and oxygen

questions.question_text: Na+ has completely filled K and L shells. Explain.
hints: K shell has 2 electrons, L shell has 8 electrons

questions.question_text: If bromine atom is available in the form of, say, two isotopes 79 35 Br (49.7%) and 81 35 Br (50.3%), calculate the average atomic mass of bromine atom.
hints: average atomic mass is the weighted sum of the masses of the isotopes

questions.question_text: The average atomic mass of a sample of an element X is 16.2 u. What are the percentages of isotopes 16 8 X and 18 8 X in the sample?
hints: percentages can be calculated using the average atomic mass

questions.question_text: If Z = 3, what would be the valency of the element? Also, name the element.
hints: valency is the combining capacity of an atom

questions.question_text: Composition of the nuclei of two atomic species X and Y are given as under X Y Protons = 6 6 Neutrons = 6 8 Give the mass numbers of X and Y. What is the relation between the two species?
hints: mass number is the sum of protons and neutrons

questions.question_text: For the following statements, write T for True and F for False. (a) J.J. Thomson proposed that the nucleus of an atom contains only nucleons. (b) A neutron is formed by an electron and a proton combining together. Therefore, it is neutral. (c) The mass of an electron is about 1 2000 times that of proton. (d) An isotope of iodine is used for making tincture iodine, which is used as a medicine.
hints: statements can be evaluated based on the text

questions.question_text: Rutherford’s alpha-particle scattering experiment was responsible for the discovery of (a) Atomic Nucleus (b) Electron (c) Proton (d) Neutron
hints: Rutherford's experiment discovered the atomic nucleus

questions.question_text: Isotopes of an element have (a) the same physical properties (b) different chemical properties (c) different number of neutrons (d) different atomic numbers.
hints: isotopes have the same atomic number but different mass numbers

questions.question_text: Number of valence electrons in Cl– ion are: (a) 16 (b) 8 (c) 17 (d) 18
hints: valence electrons are the electrons in the outermost shell

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is a correct electronic configuration of sodium? (a) 2,8 (b) 8,2,1 (c) 2,1,8 (d) 2,8,1
hints: electronic configuration is the distribution of electrons in shells

hints: table can be completed using the given information
